EmailTemplate.name: ES-2017-10-23 State of Multi-Cloud Part 2.Send
EmailTemplate.subject: [E-Book] How to Manage the Challenges of Implementing Multi-Cloud
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[https://turbonomic.com/thx-wp-the-state-of-multi-cloud-part-ii-thank-you/?utm_source=turbonomic&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=state_of_multi_cloud_pt_2]]> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=There}}, Last week we shared with you our e-book The State of Multi-Cloud Architecture: Part One <[[https://turbonomic.com/thx-wp-the-state-of-multi-cloud-part-1/?utm_source=turbonomic&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=state_of_multi_cloud_pt_1]]>, part of a survey series we collaborated on with Verizon to establish a baseline for where organizations reside on their journey to the hybrid cloud. This week we're bringing to you The State of Multi-Cloud Architecture: Part Two, where we look to continue the conversation and address what can go wrong, and what does go wrong when implementing Multi-Cloud? In this E-Book we provide detailed insights and analysis on:
- Implementation Challenges
- Vendor Selection
- Technical and business requirements facing multi-cloud adoption
<[[https://turbonomic.com/thx-wp-the-state-of-multi-cloud-part-ii-thank-you/?utm_source=turbonomic&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=state_of_multi_cloud_pt_2]]>
-The Turbonomic Team
